Two of the following atmospheric pressure measuring units have the same value (1 unit of one is equal to 1 unit of the other). Can you guess witch?
I admit that this could be considered a niche question, but still, it\'s common knowledge so it counts. The correct answers were A and C: Torr and mmHg.
The measuring unit Torr comes from the name of its inventor: Evangelista Torricelli, an Italian physicist and mathematician
